answers.author: Melissa Nell
answers.text:
We are still ni the piloting stages of our QR codes, but there are some general best practices we use when working with the codes:
   * Include instructions for using QR codes and how to obtain 
     a QR reader
   * Include the website address for those who do not have 
     smart phones
   * Make sure the web page is viewable by mobile 
   * Avoid Adobe Flash, it is not accessible on the iPhone
   * Pages optimized for mobile are best
   * The code should be no smaller than 1" square
   * Reflective surfaces makes it harder to scan, try to use 
     larger codes
   * Link shorteners like bit.ly or goo.gl will make the code less 
     intricate and less error-prone
   * Leave a "quiet zone" around the code to make scanning 
     easier
   * Codes work best in black and white
   * If using colors choose high contrasts between the light and 
     dark areas
   * DO NOT invert the colors (black where there was white, 
     etc), the codes will not work

author: Joseph Gilkerson
text:
Stafford County Va is exploring the use of QR Codes as another means to engage our citizens.  Any lessons learned or best practices from other local governments would be appreciated.  
Thanks in advance.
